       AN ACT to amend the public authorities law, in relation  to  prohibiting
         the imposition of a toll on intra-borough bridges

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 553 of the public authorities  law  is  amended  by
    2  adding a new subdivision 12-a to read as follows:
    3    12-A.  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, THE AUTHORITY SHALL
    4  NOT IMPOSE A TOLL OR FEE FOR THE USE OF ANY INTRA-BOROUGH BRIDGE.
    5    S 2. This act shall take effect on the sixtieth  day  after  it  shall
    6  have become a law.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1952

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the public authorities law, in relation to prohibiting the
imposition of a toll on
intra-borough bridges

SUMMARY:
Amends section five hundred fifty-three of the public
Authorities Law by adding a new subdivision twelve-a, prohibiting
the imposition of a toll or fee for the use of any intra-borough
bridge.

JUSTIFICATION:
To require a toll on an intra-borough bridge divides
communities, neighborhoods and prohibits access to local services. It
is a grossly unfair policy to allow tolls on such bridges. such a
toll creates a negative impact on communities by requiring
individuals to pay a toll several times a day just to accomplish
normal, everyday chores.
This is wholly different from the usual bridge toll which is
encountered only twice daily by workers to and from their place of
employment.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
Undetermined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the sixtieth day after it shall have
become a law.
